properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch Ended

Description: Conditions are no longer favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms. ###

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Periods of rain at times heavy will continue this evening. Rain at times heavy associated with a trough of low pressure approaching from the west will continue this evening with risk of thundershowers. Parts of western Nova Scotia have already received between 15 an 30 millimetres of rain, and total amounts could reach near 45 millimetres in those areas before ending later this evening. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-13T02:57:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-12T18:58:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1706032259.2019
Area: Digby County, Lunenburg County, Queens County, Shelburne County, Yarmouth County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Periods of rain and local thunderstorms giving significant rainfall into this evening. A low pressure system tracking northeastward over the regions this evening will give total rainfall amounts near 40 millimetres. There is also the chance of higher amounts due to thunderstorms. The rain will end tonight and the low pressure system will track east of the regions early Saturday morning. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-13T03:39:13-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-12T19:40:13-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1053321295.2019
Area: Peawanuck, Webequie
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: High levels of air pollution due to smoke from forest fires will continue into the weekend for a portion of Far Northwestern Ontario. Smoke plumes are moving over the region from several forest fires located in the Sandy Lake - Pikangikum region. Air quality may deteriorate if the smoke descends to ground level. The smoke plumes may affect the regions into the weekend as the wind direction will be northwesterly or westerly. If you or those in your care are exposed to wildfire smoke, consider taking extra precautions to reduce your exposure. Wildfire smoke is a constantly-changing mixture of particles and gasses which includes many chemicals that can harm your health. For more details, please consult www.canada.ca/en/environment-climate-change/services/air-quality-health-index/wildfire-smoke.html. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors, and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-07-13T12:12:29-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the Province of Ontario, 2019-07-12T20:13:29-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1104894641.2019
Area: Sachigo Lake - Bearskin Lake, Sandy Lake - Weagamow Lake - Deer Lake, Pikangikum - Poplar Hill - MacDowell
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the Province of Ontario

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain at times heavy will continue this evening. Rain at times heavy associated with a trough of low pressure approaching from the west will continue this evening with risk of thundershowers. Parts of southwestern New Brunswick have already received between 15 an 25 millimetres of rain, and total amounts could reach near 40 millimetres in those areas impacted by the heaviest rain bands before ending late this evening. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-13T02:59:57-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-12T23:52:57-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1242583666.2019

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Alberta Emergency Alert - Wildfire Alert Cancelled
properties.Summary:
Description: This emergency alert is being cancelled and the evacuation alert for this area has been lifted. There are wildfires still burning in the Mackenzie County area and the public must be cautious and continue to monitor the County Facebook page regarding wildfire activity.### More information is also available at www.facebook.com/Mackenzie-County-262409787134568/ or contact the Mackenzie County Emergency Coordination Centre at 780-927-3718 for Mackenzie County residents.
Expires: 2019-07-19T16:14:08-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Alberta Emergency Management Agency on behalf of Mackenzie County, 2019-07-12T16:13:48-06:00, NAADS-CA-AB-AEA1-5922
Area: Mackenzie #23
properties.Author: Alberta Emergency Management Agency on behalf of Mackenzie County

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A Wreckhouse wind warning may be required for Saturday evening. The Wreckhouse area can expect southeasterly winds gusting to 80 km/h beginning Saturday afternoon. Easterly winds near 90 km/h can be expected Saturday evening with higher gusts possible near midnight. High sided vehicles, including travel trailers, are vulnerable to these winds. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-07-13T09:10:33-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-13T01:11:33-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4253596562.2019
Area: Channel-Port aux Basques and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. Scattered thunderstorms will track eastward across portions of the regions this afternoon into early this evening. Wind gusts of 90 km/h, nickel sized hail and torrential downpours are possible with some of these storms, as well as frequent cloud to ground lightning. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2019-07-13T08:27:34-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-12T20:28:34-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3116700984.2019
Area: Nakina - Aroland - Pagwa, Geraldton - Longlac - Caramat, Manitouwadge - Hornepayne

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. Scattered thunderstorms are developing along a stationary front over extreme southern Saskatchewan this afternoon. Some of these thunderstorms may become severe. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-13T05:21:37-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-12T20:23:37-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1220961298.2019
